intro: Chazaliella lophoclada, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual with striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has slender, branching stems and hairy leaves adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are tubular and typically open in the morning, closing by midday. Chazaliella lophoclada is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to desert conditions due to its drought tolerance.
